thread.title: Jefferson’s Blue is going purple

title: Jefferson’s Blue is going purple
text:
Jefferson's Blue is going purple Jefferson's Blue is going purple Track and field: Sprinting star will run at UNI Cedar Rapids Jefferson , Gazette , Iowa Prep Sports , Prep Sports , Prep Track and Field , Preps Etc. By Jeff Linder , Sports , Sports Rotator , Photos Cedar Rapids Jefferson’s Jasmine Blue runs the anchor leg during the Class 4A 400-meter relay at the state track and field meet May 23. The J-Hawks won the event. Blue said Thursday that she will run at Northern Iowa. (Jim Slosiarek/The Gazette) Iowa Football Data Center

SOMERSAULTS GYMNASTS SHINE AT 2 EVENTS 
Laura Swart of the Somersau Jeff Linder , The Gazette October 22, 2015 | 6:30 pm 
CEDAR RAPIDS — Jasmine Blue sees a lot of similarities between her current track coach and her future track coaches. 
“They remind me a lot of Coach (Bill) Calloway,” Blue said Thursday in discussing her decision to orally commit to the University of Northern Iowa. “I felt a real connection with them.” 
A senior sprinter at Cedar Rapids Jefferson, Blue divulged her decision Thursday morning on Twitter. She picked UNI over Illinois State, Western Illinois and South Dakota State, among others. 
“At first, I thought (the recruiting process) was going to be so fun,” Blue said. “Then it kind of started to drag and it became pretty stressful. 
“Nothing felt quite right until I talked more with UNI. They wanted to know about me as a person.” 
Blue has been a cornerstone of the Jefferson sprinting corps since her arrival as a freshman. Last spring, the J-Hawks won state titles in the 400- and 800-meter relays and were second in the sprint medley relay. 
Jefferson owns the all-time Iowa best in the 800 relay (1:39.24, set at the 2015 state meet) and shares the Iowa record in the 400 relay (47.55, at the 2015 Drake Relays). 
Blue intends to major in sports marketing and management at UNI.
